meaningMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>pluck</kanji> so the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to pluck</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to pick</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to prune</vocabulary>, like with plants.
readingMnemonic: You are going outside <vocabulary>to pluck</vocabulary> <reading>two</reading> (つ) of your favorite flowers.
